intro: Potentilla isosepala, commonly known as the alpine potentilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10-30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Potentilla isosepala is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine meadows.
